subs.rawText: @sevensixfive If God had wanted us to see the Columbian Exhibition, he would have had us be born in the 19th century. As was my great grandmother, who found the San Francisco earthquake more memorable than the subsequent exhibition.

subs.text: @sevensixfive Since the earthquake likely contributed to her subsequent miscarriage, and thereby to the birth of my grandmother two years later, I ask that time travelers not interfere with early 20th century Californian plate tectonics.

subs.text: @christapeterso Rho might have discovered the counter on his own, as my Trooper did. Where he discovered a love for bread.
subs.rawText: @christapeterso Rho might have discovered the counter on his own, as my Trooper did. Where he discovered a love for bread.

subs.text: @christapeterso It was a live that transcended the plastic bags the bread came in. It was a love that transcended the bread box I bought to protect the bread from Trooper.
subs.rawText: @christapeterso It was a live that transcended the plastic bags the bread came in. It was a love that transcended the bread box I bought to protect the bread from Trooper.

subs.text: @christapeterso It was a love that figured out how to open the refrigerator when I began storing the bread there.
subs.rawText: @christapeterso It was a love that figured out how to open the refrigerator when I began storing the bread there.

subs.text: @christapeterso Fortunately, even Trooper’s love for bread could not transcend the wooden refrigerator guard my father built in his workshop. Which also cut down on my own refrigerator browsing.
